creator: WBaer@gmx.de
text:
Hi,

please convert the current usage of sun.misc.BASE64Encoder in SplashTask to
an official available implementation. This prevents compilation and
usage (at least with password enabled proxy) of this Task on free java
runtimes.

One possibility would be to use the existing commons.codec package which
has an implementation and specify this as an dependency for the splash
task.

Thanks for consideration,

Wolfgang

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
Actually, Ant has its own internal Base64 encoder (a nested class of the Get 
task).  Get uses this class for HTTP auth. encoding; big surprise that's what 
SplashTask wants it for as well.  IMHO the "right" thing to do here is modify 
SplashTask to use Get, consolidating this code.  First Get will have to support 
arbitrary output destinations, though.  I had intended this to be provided via 
a nested I/O redirector... just one of the many items on my TODO list.

Created attachment 15632
Converts SplashTask to NOT use sun internal classes

Extracts the Base64Converter from the Get task into the tools.ant.utils
package as a new class and uses it from both the Get and the SplashScreen task.


One has to remove the com.sun.Base64Encoder checks in the build.xml
